page.title: 07Plants and Wild Flowers
page.content: ECOLOGY IN THE DELABOLE AREA. {Plants.}By Catherine Tanner. Our area rises up from the sea to 700 feet,so we are very exposed to the sea-winds.On our{cliffs}there are lots of different plants.Half way down the cliffs you mainly get thrift and rough patches of grass,but on the top of the cliff you get a wider variety. There is gorse,bracken,rough grass, heathers, ox-eye daisies,and plantain. In{farmland,}there are bluebells, foxgloves, herb robert and dandelions. We don't have many trees, mainly hawthorn,brambles and sloe survive, because the winds stunt the growth of the trees. But the {woodland }is in a steep-sided,sheltered valley so quite large trees can grow there: sycamore, ash ,oak, beech and pine.
